On [[5 January]] [[1967]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien|a letter]] to [[Joy Hill]]'''.<ref name=C>{{CG|C}}, p. 685</ref>

*'''Subject:''' Tolkien thanks Hill for sending [[List of books in Tolkien's library#The Children's Treasury of Literature|a copy]] of ''[[The Children's Treasury of Literature]]'' which included a chapter from ''[[The Hobbit]]'', illustrated by Robert J. Lee. Tolkien did not like the illustrations at all, calling them vulgar and stupid. He ends the letter by discussing his ''[[Beowulf (poem)|Beowulf]]'' lecture.
*'''Publication:''' A description of the letter was published in [[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide|''The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide: Chronology'']] (p. 685).
